title: Resume
text:

M.S. in Data Science and Analytics

Georgetown University
2024 - 2025
GPA: 4.0

B.S. in Chemical Engineering | Minor in Energy Engineering

Washington University in St.Â Louis
2017 - 2021
GPA: 3.98
Honors: Summa Cum Laude





Consultant â€” PricewaterhouseCoopers
Aug 2021 - Aug 2024

Led technical requirement gathering and oversaw the design and implementation of a Medicare Stars data mart and cube
Facilitated data mapping through SQL queries, and contributed to the design of the relational database schema composed of fourteen datasets for the data mart
Managed a team of 10 developers, providing guidance on technical and business requirements, offering subject matter expertise, and conducting unit testing to ensure high-quality deliverables
Developed a technology strategy for a major healthcare payer, assessing technology across claims, billing, enrollment, and provider domains; defined optimal architecture to support business objectives
Advised a large pharmaceutical benefit manager on implementing program governance models, enhancing operational efficiencies crucial for securing capital funding
Coordinated the transition of an in-flight program to an agile delivery model by managing three program managers across four workstreams to help technology and product teams execute on the roadmap

Graduate Teaching Assistant â€” Georgetown University
May 2025 - Aug 2025

Assisted incoming graduate students in mastering Python and R programming fundamentals through instruction, feedback, and one-on-one support in a required summer course





Vehicle Collisions Classifications Using Neural Networks, Neural Networks & Advanced Deep Learning (DSAN 6600)

Processed 60,000+ frames extracted from 1,500 dashcam videos to classify collision vs.Â non-collision events using spatial and temporal features
Utilized YOLOv8 for spatial feature extraction and LSTM, GRU, and Transformer architectures for temporal sequence modeling
Optimized deep learning pipeline with PyTorch, improving model generalization and reducing training time through data augmentation and hyperparameter tuning

Predictive Modeling of Chronic Absenteeism in U.S. Public Schools, Statistical Learning (DSAN 5300)

Collected and merged datasets from ~13,000 school districts covering demographic, financial, and attendance data
Engineered predictive features to classify districts into high, medium, and low chronic absenteeism risk levels
Implemented and compared models including Random Forests, Neural Networks, SVM, Logistic Regression, and LDA/QDA, achieving high accuracy in absenteeism risk prediction

Data-Driven Discovery of Patterns in Music, Data Science and Analytics (DSAN 5000)

Collected and integrated data from the Spotify API to analyze patterns in music features, genres, and popularity
Applied unsupervised clustering to group songs based on acoustic attributes (tempo, energy, danceability), uncovering latent structure across genres
Built supervised regression and classification models to predict song popularity and genre, identifying key drivers of listener engagement






Programming: Python, R, SQL, MongoDB, MATLAB, HTML, CSS, Selenium
Data Analysis and Visualization: NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly, NetworkX, Altair
Machine learning frameworks: PyTorch, Keras, TensorFlow, scikit-learn
Miscellaneous: Git, Github, Quarto, bash, Docker

title: Personal Projects

Personal Projects
